page.title: 15POLKA CHILDREN'S THEATRE
page.content:
The Polka Chidren's Theatre started as a touring theatre in 1967 by Richard Gill and his wife.It was originally financed by royalties and then a grant from the arts council.The Polka Theatre uses actors and puppets,and have toured all round the country and abroad performing in many famous and regional theatres and at festivals, schools, hospitals etc.In 1977 Holy Trinity Halls and the house next door were bought and converted into the Polka Children's Theatre building.A public appeal was launched with wonderful response and the building was opened by the Queen Mother on November 20th 1979, with a gala performance of "Circus Parade".
